intro: Heptapleurum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Borneo, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
